org.microtitan.diffusive.diffuser

Interface Diffuser

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDiffuser, LocalDiffuser, RestfulDiffuser

    public interface Diffuser
    The Diffuser is responsible for running the specified object's method. For local Diffusers this means that the Diffuser will run the method in the local process. Remote Diffusers are responsible for communicating with Diffusers in other processes or across the network, providing them with the information needed to run the specified method, and then gathering the results of the method invocation. Remote Diffuser usually work with Serializer objects that take the objects into and out of a serialized/persisted form so that they (their entire object tree) can be transported across the network to a Diffuser that can reconstruct the object and execute the method. The runObject(...) methods defined in this interface are expected to handle local calls and remote calls. In the case of local calls, the implementation of these methods are intended to diffuse the code to a Diffuser running remotely. In the case of remote calls, the implementation of these methods should either run the method locally and return the results, or diffuse the code to another remote Diffuser, which in turn would do the same.
    Author:
    Robert Philipp
    See Also:
    LocalDiffuser, RestfulDiffuser

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Object runObject(double load, java.lang.Class<?> returnType, java.lang.Object object, java.lang.String methodName)
      Runs the specified no-arg method on the specified object.

      Runs the specified method on the specified object.
      java.lang.Object runObject(double load, java.lang.Class<?> returnType, java.lang.Object object, java.lang.String methodName, java.lang.Class<?> argType, java.lang.Object argument)

    • Method Detail

      • runObject

        java.lang.Object runObject(double load,
                         java.lang.Class<?> returnType,
                         java.lang.Object object,
                         java.lang.String methodName)
        Runs the specified no-arg method on the specified object.
        Parameters:
        load - The CPU load gives the load (under a measure specified by the implementation of the DiffuserLoadCalc). The load is compared to a configured load threshold. If the load is less than the threshold, then the Diffuser ought to execute the task locally. On the other hand, if the load is larger than the threshold, then the Diffuser ought to forward the task to a remote Diffuser. The remote Diffuser is selected based on a configured DiffuserStrategy, which returns the end-point of the remove Diffuser to which to forward the task.
        object - The object on which to make the method call given by the specified method name
        methodName - The name of the method to call on the object
        Returns:
        The result of the method on the specified object
        See Also:
        #runObject(Object, String, Object), #runObject(Object, String, Object...)

      • runObject

        java.lang.Object runObject(double load,
                         java.lang.Class<?> returnType,
                         java.lang.Object object,
                         java.lang.String methodName,
                         java.lang.Class<?> argType,
                         java.lang.Object argument)
        Runs the specified single-argument method on the specified object.
        Parameters:
        load - The CPU load gives the load (under a measure specified by the implementation of the DiffuserLoadCalc). The load is compared to a configured load threshold. If the load is less than the threshold, then the Diffuser ought to execute the task locally. On the other hand, if the load is larger than the threshold, then the Diffuser ought to forward the task to a remote Diffuser. The remote Diffuser is selected based on a configured DiffuserStrategy, which returns the end-point of the remove Diffuser to which to forward the task.
        object - The object on which to make the method call given by the specified method name
        methodName - The name of the method to call on the object
        argType - The type of the argument. This is necessary to preserve primitive arguments which would otherwise be automatically autoboxed.
        argument - The argument to be passed to the method. Typically the implementing class will use reflection to determine the Method, and so the parameter type will be used as part of the signature.
        Returns:
        The result of the method on the specified object
        See Also:
        #runObject(Object, String), #runObject(Object, String, Object...)

      • runObject

        java.lang.Object runObject(double load,
                         java.lang.Class<?> returnType,
                         java.lang.Object object,
                         java.lang.String methodName,
                         java.lang.Class<?>[] argTypes,
                         java.lang.Object... arguments)
        Runs the specified method on the specified object.
        Parameters:
        load - The CPU load gives the load (under a measure specified by the implementation of the DiffuserLoadCalc). The load is compared to a configured load threshold. If the load is less than the threshold, then the Diffuser ought to execute the task locally. On the other hand, if the load is larger than the threshold, then the Diffuser ought to forward the task to a remote Diffuser. The remote Diffuser is selected based on a configured DiffuserStrategy, which returns the end-point of the remove Diffuser to which to forward the task.
        object - The object on which to make the method call given by the specified method name
        methodName - The name of the method to call on the object
        argTypes - The types of the arguments. This is necessary to preserve primitive arguments which would otherwise be automatically autoboxed.
        arguments - The arguments to be passed to the method. Typically the implementing class will use reflection to determine the Method, and so the parameter types will be used as part of the signature.
        Returns:
        The result of the method on the specified object
        See Also:
        #runObject(Object, String), #runObject(Object, String, Object)
